# lowercase and remove punctuation
    text = text.lower()
    text = text.replace("'", "")
    text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text)

    # split into words
    words = text.split()

    # count the frequency of each word
    common_words = Counter(words).most_common()

    # plot the top 10 most common words
    common_words_list = [word_count for word_count in common_words if word_count[0] not in ['a', 'an', 'of', 'or', 'on', 'by', 'at', 'the', 'an', 'with', 'for', 'from', 'to', 'in', 'and', 'or', 'from', 'the', 'of', 'it', 'it', 'in']]

    x = []
    y = []

    for word, count in common_words_list:
        x.append(word)

# Create a regular expression object for punctuation
    punctuation = re.compile('[^A-Za-z\']')
    # Create a regular expression object for contractions
    contractions = re.compile("[^A-Za-z\']")
    # Split the text into words and remove punctuation and contractions
    words = [word.strip(punctuation).lower() for word in text.split()]
    # Remove empty words and words with contractions
    words = [word for word in words if word != '' and not contractions.search(word)]
    # Count the frequency of each word
    common_words = Counter(words).most_common(10)
    # Create a bar chart of the 10 most common words
    common_word_freq, common_word_labels = zip(*common_words)
    plt.bar(common_word_labels, common_word_freq, color='b')
    plt.xticks(common_word_labels, common_word_labels, rotation=45)
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt

# Remove punctuation from the input text
    text_without_punct = ''.join(char for char in text if char not in punctuation)
    text_without_punct = text_without_punct.lower()

    # Split the input text into words
    words_list = text_without_punct.split()

    # Count the frequency of each word
    word_counts = Counter(words_list)

    # Get the top 10 most common words
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Create a matplotlib Axes object for the plot
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()

    # Plot the top 10 words with their counts
    for word, count in common_words:
        ax.bar(word, count, align='center')

    # Return the top 10 most common words and the matplotlib Axes object for the plot
    return common_words, ax

# Clean the input text: Remove all punctuation, split into words, and lowercase all words
    words = re.findall(r'\w+', text.lower())

    # Create a Counter object to count the frequency of each word
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Create the list of tuples: the 10 most common words and their counts
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Create the Axes object
    ax = plt.subplot(111)

    # Plot the bar chart
    x_pos = range(len(common_words))
    y_pos = [count for word, count in common_words]
    plt.bar(x_pos, y_pos)

    # Add labels to the bar chart
    plt.xticks(x_pos, [word for word, count in common_words])
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('Top 10 Most Common Words')

    # Return the common words and Axes object
    return common_words, ax

# Remove punctuation and whitespace
    text = text.lower()
    pattern = re.compile(r"[\w']+")
    words = re.findall(pattern, text)
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Plot the top 10 most common words
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)
    ax = plt.bar([i[0] for i in common_words], [i[1] for i in common_words])
    return common_words, ax

# Split the text into words
    words = re.findall(r"[a-zA-Z']+", text.lower())

    # Remove punctuation and extra spaces
    words = [word.strip(" !@#$%^&*()-_+") for word in words]

    # Count the occurrences of each word
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Plot the top 10 most common words using matplotlib
    words_sorted = sorted(word_counts, key=word_counts.get, reverse=True)[:10]
    common_words = [(word, word_counts[word]) for word in words_sorted]
    common_words = sorted(common_words, key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)

    # Create a bar chart
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()

    # Plot the top 10 most common words with bars
    ax.barh(range(1, 11), [word_counts[word] for word in words_sorted])

# Split the text into a list of words
    words = re.findall(r"\w+", text.lower())

    # Count the occurrences of each word
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Sort the words by their count in descending order
    common_words = word_counts.most_common()

    # Create a bar chart with the top 10 words and their counts
    words, counts = zip(*common_words)
    plt.bar(range(len(words)), counts)
    ax = plt.gca()
    ax.set_xticklabels(words)

    return common_words, ax

# Lowercase and remove punctuation from the text

# Define a list of non-word characters (excluding spaces)

    # Split the text into a list of words by removing non-word characters and lowercasing

    # Remove empty strings
    words = [word for word in words if word]

    # Create a Counter object for the words
    counts = Counter(words)

    # Get the top 10 words and their counts
    top_10 = counts.most_common(10)

    # Create a bar plot using Matplotlib
    plt.rcdefaults()

    ax.barh(range(10), counts, align='center')

# Define regular expressions for common punctuation marks
    punctuation_re = re.compile(r'[\t\n\r\f\v]+|["«»‘’‚]|[.!?…]+|[()[\\]{}@*]')
    # Use Counter to analyze the words
    word_counts = Counter(punctuation_re.sub(' ', text).lower().split())
    # Get the 10 most common words and their counts
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)
    # Create a bar plot of the most common words
    _, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(range(1, len(common_words)+1), [count for _, count in common_words], tick_label=common_words, width=0.9,
           label=None, color='#00C0C0')
    # Set plot properties
    ax.set_xlabel('No.')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.set_title('Frequency of Words in a Text')

    words = re.findall(r"\w[\w'-]*", text.lower())

    # Count the frequency of each word

    return common_words, ax

# Convert text to lowercase and remove punctuation
    cleaned_text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text.lower())

    # Split the text into words
    words = cleaned_text.split()

    # Count the occurrences of each word
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Sort the words by count in descending order
    sorted_words = sorted(word_counts, key=word_counts.get, reverse=True)

    # Plot the top 10 words and counts as a bar chart
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.barh(range(len(sorted_words)), [word_counts[word] for word in sorted_words])
    ax.set_yticks(range(len(sorted_words)))
    ax.set_yticklabels(sorted_words)
    ax.invert_yaxis()

    return sorted_words, ax

text = re.sub(r"[^a-zA-Z\s]", "", text)  # Remove all non-alphabetic characters
    words = text.lower().split()  # Split text into words
    count = Counter(words)  # Count words

    # Plot the top 10 most common words as a bar chart
    words_and_counts = count.most_common(10)  # Get the top 10 most common words and their counts

# Remove punctuation using regex
    text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text)

    # Split text into words
    words = text.split()

    # Remove common words (e.g., "the", "a", etc.)
    common_words = ["the", "a", "an", "and", "or", "to", "in", "from", "of", "at", "for"]
    words = [word for word in words if word.lower() not in common_words]

    # Count word frequencies
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Plot top 10 words using matplotlib
    words = list(word_counts.keys())
    counts = list(word_counts.values())
    plt.barh(words, counts)
    plt.xlabel("Words")
    plt.ylabel("Count")
    plt.title("Word Frequency")
    plt.show()

    return list(word_counts.items()), plt

    ax = plt.subplots().axes[0]

    ax.set_xticks([i for i in range(10)])
    ax.set_xticklabels([w for w, _ in most_common_words])
    ax.set_xlabel('Most common words')
    ax.set_ylabel('Count')
    ax.set_title('Top 10 most common words in the text')

    return most_common_words, ax

# Step 1: Lowercasing and removing punctuation from the input text
    text = re.sub(r"[^\w\s]", "", text.lower())

    # Step 2: Splitting into words and removing any empty strings
    words = [word for word in text.split() if word]

    # Step 3: Counting the occurrences of each word
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Step 4: Finding the top 10 most common words
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Step 5: Placing the top 10 words into a bar plot
    plt.bar([word for word, _ in common_words], [count for _, count in common_words])
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.ylabel('Number of occurrences')
    plt.xlabel('Word')
    plt.title('Top 10 most common words in text')
    plt.grid()
    plt.show()
    return common_words, plt.gca()

# Step 1: Create a new list called words_without_punctuation
    # Step 1.1: Create a regular expression pattern that matches any punctuation character.
    # Step 1.2: Use the "findall" method to find all instances of the pattern in the text.
    words_without_punctuation = re.findall(r'[\w]+', text)

    # Step 2: Convert the list to a Counter object
    # Step 2.1: Create a Counter instance called common_words
    # Step 2.2: Use the "Counter" constructor to convert the list to a Counter object.
    common_words = Counter(words_without_punctuation)

    # Step 3: Plot the top 10 words and their counts as a bar chart
    # Step 3.1: Use the "plot" method to create a new matplotlib Axes object.
    # Step 3.2: Plot the top 10 words and their counts as a bar chart.
    # Step 3.3: Use the "barh" function to create the bar chart.
    # Step 3

# Convert the text to lowercase and remove all non-alphabetic characters
    text = re.sub(r"[^a-z]", "", text.lower())

    # Split the text into words
    words = text.split()

    # Count the occurrence of each word in the text
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Sort the words based on their counts in descending order
    sorted_word_counts = sorted(word_counts.items(), key=lambda x: -x[1])

    # Get the top 10 most common words and their counts
    common_words = sorted_word_counts[:10]

    # Create a matplotlib Axes object for the plot
    ax = plt.subplots().axes

    # Plot the words and their counts as a bar chart
    x = range(len(common_words))
    words, counts = zip(*common_words)
    plt.bar(x, counts, tick_label=words)

    # Set the x and y axis labels
    ax.set_xlabel('Word')
    ax.set

text = re.sub(r'\W', '', text.lower())
    words = text.split()
    count_words = Counter(words).most_common(10)
    plt.bar([x[0] for x in count_words], [x[1] for x in count_words])
    plt.show()
    return count_words
